abstract: Officials from both Homeland Security and State Depts testify before panel consisting of bipartisan group of lawmakers, who question them about proper vetting of visitors and asylum seekers wanting to enter United States; scrutiny of entry processes has been heightened in wake of attacks in Paris and San Bernardino, Calif, and lawmakers pay particular attention to question of whether officials screened social media accounts of visa applicants.
lead_paragraph: The Oversight Committee held a hearing on the visa and asylum application processes, with both Democrats and Republicans urging more thorough vetting.

headline.main: House Panel Faults Failure to Review Visa Applicants’ Social Media Use
headline.print_headline: Panel Assails Failure to Review Visa Applicants’ Social Media Use

snippet: The Oversight Committee held a hearing on the visa and asylum application processes, with both Democrats and Republicans urging more thorough vetting.
